dict.string: Dry, but with a creamy touch of Thai Palm sugar and the spicy tang of rye, all balanced with loads of hops.
Assertively hopped traditional pale ale with a good helping of Cascade hops for a citrus hop flavor and light dry balance.
Celebrating the flavors of the freshest hop flowers, this session IPA is full flavored and reminds us of a baby Dirt Wolf IPA.
This mouthwateringly delicious IPA gets its flavor from a heavy helping of citra and mosaic hops. No fruit was harmed in the making of this beer.
Imperial Pale Ale brewed with both dry hopping and hop back methods, a truly crisp Pale ale with a strong hop finish.
The next in their single hop series, this IPA features only centennial hops and exemplifies ta slightly fruity resinous hop with light citrus hints.
One of the most floral IPAs on the market, a smooth, well balanced brew that will really impress your nose and taste buds.
A light session IPA that still packs full hop flavor, Great all day, and day
This black IPA was originally brewed as their 11th anniversary beer, hoppy and dark, they liked it so much... they kept making it.
Belgian-style Pale Ale with an American twist. Brewed with pale, caramel, and wheat malts, and hopped to give it a distinctly American character
Quintessential India Pale Ale with American malts and enormous hop addi- tions to give this beer a crisp finish and incredible floral hop aroma.
This Imperial Double Rye IPA is about as much rye as you can fit into one beer, exceptionally dry with a red color and strong rye finish.
Loaded with tropical fruit and citrus notes, deep gold in color, with tons of American hops for assertive bitterness and big hop flavor and aroma
Pungent aromatics up front with a balanced backbone and a bitter finish. The first beer ever tapped at the Federal Taphouse Lancaster.
Recently made more available due to its overwhelming popularity, this heavily hopped IPA has a piney aroma with a strong hop finish.
Incredibly limited, this high octane Imperial IPA is an explosion of hops with a sweet malt balancing out the dry hop character.
Everything you love about the Union Jack, doubled. More malt, more hops, more alcohol...just more...and more is good.
A stunning replacement for their Beyond the Gates, this Imperial IPA is almost entirely citra hops for a potent citrus blast of hop power.
4 stages of hopping create an award winning beer that embodies San Diego’s reputation for making world class IPAs.
Celebrating the bittering resin secreted from the lupulin glands of the hop cone, this beer is a strong ale with an abundance of American hop flavor.
Traditional style English mild, light and smooth, with a creamy finish just a hint of alcohol, for when you want to go a few more rounds.
A traditionally brewed and fermented root beer with a hint of bourbon and oak... it’s root beer, all grown up.
Complex and light with a nice bite, this traditional scotch wee heavy is brewed as a testament to the strength and drinkability of the style.
Brewed in America through Shipyard Brewing, this flagship ESB is incredi- bly drinkable with a touch of sweetness and a gentle malt finish.
Deep copper in color with alluring notes of spice and pumpkin, this is the one you’ve been waiting for, the King of Pumpkin Beers.
This traditional English Stock Ale, brewed with blackstrap molasses and a decent amount of Simcoe pine hops, this celebratory ale has a deep flavor profile and rich traditional heritage.
This traditional French Biere De Garde style is deep amber in color with a toasty, sweet caramel start, it finishes with just enough hops to clean off the palate.

dict.key: Anderson Valley The Kimmie, the Yink, and the Holy Gose

dict.string: Similar to a Berliner Weisse this traditional Gose beer is light, tart, and a bit sour with hints of lemon and peach.
This golden blonde ale is a light and lightly spiced ale that’s helping us say goodbye to summer.
A true to form lemon shandy, brewed with real lemonade for the perfect, refresh-ing balance of lemon and beer.
Brewed with chocolate and dark roasty flavor, this full bodied beer is one of the best standard porters currently on the market.
Traditional Scottish porter, jet black and brewed with seaweed adding just a hint of salt to the roasted coffee flavor.
Complex, roasted aroma with a bittersweet, chocolate- coffee taste and a bold hop presence.
Part Porter, part Stout, this limited release, draft only beer is a chocolaty blend of both worlds with a smooth creamy finish.
Part Porter, part Stout, this limited release, draft only beer is a chocolaty blend of both worlds with a smooth creamy finish.
Built on a foundation of dark specialty malts, framed by sturdy IBUs and crowned with a monumental dry hopping of Simcoe and Amarillo.
A slightly potent, deliciously malted porter with hints of chocolate and coffee, perfect for planning the freedom of a nation
Very dark in color, this robust porter features a pronounced flavor of roasted grains reminiscent of dark chocolate and silkiness.
This chili pepper brown ale is an experiment in spice with a light brown ale body and slight chocolate and chili pepper tangle of flavors.
A huge helping of vanilla and coffee beans help this porter gain its smooth texture and rich, creamy mouth feel.
A smooth refreshing lager fermented and aged for five weeks at cold temperatures to yield its exceptionally smooth flavor
A world class, slightly pale German style pilsner with a clean, crisp refreshing import taste.
A genuine pilsner, every sip releases its characteristic lightly bitter taste on your palate. For the Stella aficionado, this is your choice.
Heaps of hops give this pale lager a bracing, herbal bite over layers of soft and smooth malt flavor.
Traditional Kolsch style, this incredibly light lager is crisp and re- freshing with just a slightest hint of of lightly sweet malt.
Pale straw colored and delivering floral hop notes and smooth malt character from extended cold aging, crisp, flavorful and refreshing.
From the world’s oldest brewery, this slightly bitter, mild pilsner with a fragrance of hops, is the quintessential german pilsner.
This confused IPA is actually a golden lager with a heavy hop profile and smooth bready lager finish.
This new age twist on a classic pils is light and refreshing with a slight euro pilsner linger and bright hops flavor.
An Imperial Pilsner, this crisp, refreshing beer gives just a little more of everything you love about the style.
Meaning Pineapple in Hawaiian, this fruity light lager tastes like alcoholic pineapple soda... a dangerously good summer beer.
Exceptionally smooth dark lager has a deep chestnut brown hue, with a medium-bodied palate and subtle hop bitterness on the finish
Deep amber red color. Rich caramelized malt and noble hop flavors harmonize on the palate, leading to a crisp, clean finish

dict.key: Great Lakes / Cigar City Wandering Pelican

dict.string: In honor of a Pelican that made its way from Florida to Lake Erie, this Schwarzbier collaboration is stronger than most with a dark smoky flavor and slightly sweet malt.
The perfect American Oktoberfest, a smooth amber lager with a full flavor and refreshing drinkability, a fantastic fall beer.
Bavarian barley slow roasted, caramelized to a rich, red amber color combined with exclusive yeast and the finest hops.
The best selling beer on the market currently, this Light Adjunct Lager isn’t quite craft... but it is beer.
Embraced as the only Lager you’ll ever need, this local favorite is lighter than most but still deeply flavored with a great amber color.
Nicknamed “Blue” because of its label this refreshing pilsner has a distinctive hoppy aroma, and a slightly sweet after-taste.
Extremely light colored, light in body, and high in carbonation, with a crisp cold flavor... tastes like the Rockies?
A summer release, this high energy Berliner Weisse packs a whole lot of peach into a very little punch

dict.key: RJ Rockers Son of a Peach

dict.string: An unfiltered American wheat ale made with real mean peaches. The only thing missing is the fuzz. Savor the anger.
An unfiltered American wheat ale made with real mean peaches. The only thing missing is the fuzz. Savor the anger.
A gentle wheat beer with just a hint of apricot flavor in the finish. A very drinkable, mildly fruity ale.
A refreshingly sessionable summer seasonal brewed with both sweet and curacao bitter orange peel, topped with coriander.
A well balanced royal Bavarian Hefeweizen from the family brewery that owned the rights to the style for over 200 years.
Spicy, peppery, clove taste and slight hint of bananas. This wheat is an unfiltered blast of spicy, mouthwatering joy.
Brewed as a traditional Belgian Witbier, this unfiltered summer beer is slightly spiced and incredibly drinkable and refreshing.

dict.key: Starr Hill’s Whiter Shade of Pale

dict.string: The perfect marriage of a Belgian Wheat and an IPA, the strong hop profile blends with intense citrus and spice for wonderful flavor and drinkability.
Offering a tamed tempest of flavors both spicy and sublime, this softly fermented traditional witbier greets the nose and tingles the tongue.
Often called Chimay “White” because of the label, a Belgian Tripel that provides a subtle hint of fruit and tart with a clean finish.
With slight hints of port and sherry, this malty Abbey Dubbel has subtle notes of chocolate with a mild nutty finish.
This limited release ale is usually a Christmas beer, but aged for sum- mer drinking its light body and chocolaty spiced flavor is both decadent and drinkable,
Trappist inspired Belgian Strong Brown ale, this potent dark beer is aged for six months with hints of red fruit and spice.
This incredibly light wild ale drinks like a sour with the tartness of a lambic, golden in color and highly sessionable.
Brewed on a dare, this traditional Belgian sour gets its tartness from fresh fermented apples and pears along with sour yeast
Belgian Strong Dark with a beautiful caramel color and massive amounts of malt, and subtle hints of cherry, caramel, and vanilla.

dict.key: Roy Pitz Lay Down Stay Down

dict.string: Deliberately aged until mildly sour, this Belgian Strong Ale with Belgian candy sugar has a sour hint of plum and dark fruit.
A Belgian-inspired beer in the “Grand Cru” style, subtly infused with lem- on, saffron, crystalized honey, fresh kaffir lime leaves, and rare peppers
Their first ever beer, this traiditional Belgian Tripel is brewed with corian- der and orange for a sweet deceivingly strong American Belgian.
This crisp and refreshing cider mixes the sweetness of the apples with a subtle dryness for a balanced cider taste.
An inspiration to hard cider – incredibly light and tart with a mild lemon flavor and refreshing summery finish.
This world famous raspberry lambic is brewed with tons of fresh fruit and with a deep red color is surprisingly light and refreshing.
This traditional dry cider drinks almost like a sparkling white wine, gluten free and brewed with real apples.
A Gluten Free Belgian style golden ale, full flavored, mildly bitter, clean and refreshing one of the best true gluten free beers on the market.
This French style Saison has a dry champagne like finish with sutble hints of citrus and fruit and a slightly cloudy Belgian texture.
This black saison is one of the most unique beers on tap, a dark twist of tart and bitter it drinks almost like a summery stout.
A malty summer session beer with a crisp mouthful and a sweet finish. Blended with a touch of caramel. Its practically cream soda for grown-ups.
This apple flavored golden ale is light and fruity with a slightly bready char- acter and clean golden ale finish.
A brown English ale that gets its bready taste from the traditional style, and its ripe banana flavor from...you guessed it... bananas
Aged for 8 months, this vintage barrel is refined with a smoother, lighter finish and subtle hints of coffee and a drinkable dark body.
Oatmeal stout brewed with a healthy dose of coffee, pours dark and smooth for a true java head’s delight.
Using Belgian yeast to hide a slight tart bitternes under tons of coffee, this stout is a cele- bration of both breweries love for dark beer and collaboration.
Combining fresh chocolate with heavy dark malts into a supremely rich imperial stout, makes this incredibly close to alcoholic brownie batter.
This full bodied chocolate stout is brewed with real peppermint for a truly minty addition to their line of ground breaking dark beers.
Spiked with cinnamon, clove, ginger, and nutmeg, this Gingerbread Stout has huge flavor and a smooth full body.
Near the top of the Russian Imperial market, this beer is a dark, rich ale with generous sweetness with roasted malt bitterness to hide the alcohol.
With ten varieties of malted barley this imperial stout is impossibly dark with a huge bite and creamy notes of chocolate and coffee.
One of the best nitro oatmeal stouts on the market, its smooth creamy texture and light chocolaty flavor with a subtle hint of oat is incredibly deli- cious and makes great car bombs!
With just the right amount of northwest hops. This creamy nitro pale ale has an unbelievable body and a mouthwatering linger of pine and citrus.
